p: Citrus sinensis contains several active secondary metabolites contributing to the pharmacological activities of the plant. In Citrus sinensis fruits, peel, leaves, juice, and roots, several types of chemical compounds including flavonoids [ 2, 32], hydroxyamides, steroids, alkanes and fatty acids, coumarins, carbohydrates, peptides, carbamates and alkylamines, carotenoids, volatile compounds, and minerals such as potassium, magnesium, calcium, and sodium have been identified [ 12, 33].
